cards.name: A Flawless World
cards.text:
You draw two cards and you gain 3 life.
Coalesce {5}{W}{U} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {5}{W}{U}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)

cards.name: A Sight Too Far
cards.text:
Each opponent loses X life and you gain X life, where X is the number of Illusions you control.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: A Vision Too Vast
cards.text:
Each player mills four cards.
Coalesce {5}{U}{U} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {5}{U}{U}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
When A Vision Too Vast enters, you may cast target noncreature, nonland card with mana value 4 or less from a graveyard without paying its mana cost.

cards.name: Abjuration Savant
cards.text:
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Abjuration Savant. It gains flying until end of turn.
When Abjuration Savant dies, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.name: Ancestor's Bulwark
Angel of the Eclipse
cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Angel of the Eclipse deals combat damage, it deals that much damage to each attacking and blocking creature.
Prevent all damage that would be dealt to Angel of the Eclipse by sources you control.

cards.flavor: There is a limit to thinking about even a small piece of something monumental. The shadow of the whole rears up behind you, and you become lost in part from the panic of realizing the size of that imagined leviathan.
cards.name: Annihilation
cards.text: Annihilation deals X damage to any target.

cards.flavor: Outside, the howling was incessant. And Mishka's illusions could do little to silence them.
cards.name: Ashka's Hunter
cards.text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature enters under your control, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
This creature can't be blocked by creatures with power 1 or less.

cards.name: Ashka Ritualist
cards.text:
Trample
When Ashka Ritualist enters or whenever you cast a spell, if {R}{W} was spent to cast it, create two 1/1 red and green Warrior creature tokens. Put a +1/+1 counter on Ashka Ritualist.

cards.flavor: “Our destiny is greater than this life. Join us, and become a part of something endless.”
cards.name: Ashkan Preserver
cards.text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature enters under your control, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
This creature can't be sacrificed.

cards.name: Bearer of Silk Chains
cards.text: When Bearer of Silk Chains enters, gain control of target nonland permanent until Bearer of Silk Chains leaves the battlefield. If that permanent is a Horror, gain control of it instead.

cards.name: Bearer of Tormented Truths
cards.text:
When Bearer of Tormented Truths enters, look at target player's hand. You may exile a nonland card from among them. If you do, that player draws a card.
You may play cards exiled with Bearer of Tormented Truths, and you may spend mana as though it was mana of any color to cast them.

cards.name: Beckon the Pack
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Search your library for a creature card with mana value equal to the sacrificed creature's mana value minus 1, put it onto the battlefield, then create a token that's a copy of that creature. Then shuffle.

cards.flavor: The world moves towards its unmaking as the creators take back what is theirs. Preparing to start again. And again. And again. Learning from their creation and growing stronger from it.
cards.name: Become Nothing
cards.text: Counter target spell. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Beyond All Horizons
cards.text:
Search your library for a land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle.
Coalesce {5}{G}{G} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {5}{G}{G}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
Beyond All Horizons's power and toughness are each equal to the number of lands you 
control.

cards.name: Bind the Mind
cards.text:
When Bind the Mind enters, each poisoned opponent reveals their hand. Then choose a nonland card name.
Spells with the chosen name can't be cast.

cards.name: Black Hole Musings
cards.text:
You lose 1 life and exile the top card of your library. You may repeat this process any number of times. Then put up to two cards exiled this way into your hand.
Coalesce {5}{B}{B} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {5}{B}{B}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
Black Hole Musings's power is equal to the number of cards in exile.

cards.name: Blessed Piper
cards.text: {1}{G}, {T}: You may put a creature or Revelation card from your hand onto the battlefield. Exile that permanent if it would leave the battlefield. If it's a Revelation, it enters as a Horror creature and you may cast a copy of it without paying its mana cost.

cards.flavor: Countless phantom limbs filled the air around the thing that had once been the Twin-Star clan.
cards.name: Blessing of Ashka

rulings.text: The ability counts itself, so this will always give at least +4/+4.

cards.text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature you control enters, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
This permanent gets +2/+2 for each card and token merged with it.

cards.flavor: “What will you do with that blade? Will you strike me down? Best make it count. Best make it hurt. Best kill me in one blow. For you won't survive the guilt if you don't.”
cards.name: Blessing of Helar
cards.text: Whenever one or more creatures an opponent controls attack you or a planeswalker you control, that player gets a poison counter.

cards.name: Blessing of Roya
cards.text: When Blessing of Roya enters or whenever you cast a spell from a graveyard, you gain 5 life and you mill five cards. Then you may put a card from your graveyard on the bottom of your library.

cards.flavor:
Burdened by the whispers, Mishka couldn't even trust themself to struggle as Tahli approached.
“We will make you the seer your clan deserves,” Tahli assured her. “We will make you see.”
cards.name: Blessing of Setar
cards.text: Whenever you cast an instant or sorcery spell from exile, copy it. You may choose new targets for the copy.

cards.flavor: There is a price to pay when looking beyond the veil of death.
cards.name: Blinded Necromancer
cards.text:
Lifelink
Revive {3}{B} ({3}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of this card, except it has no mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.)

cards.name: Blooming Martyr
cards.text:
Menace
Revive {1}{R} ({1}{R}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of this card, except it has no mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.)

cards.name: Born Anew
cards.text:
Your life total becomes 20.
Coalesce {8}{W}{W}{W}{W} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {8}{W}{W}{W}{W}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
Born Anew's power and toughness are each equal to your life total.

changes: 2022-05-01 — Now exiles the target and freecasts the copy instead of just casting it.
cards.name: Breach the Lilies
cards.text:
Exile target nonland card with mana value 2 or less from your graveyard. Copy it. You may cast the copy without paying its mana cost.
Exile Breach the Lilies.

cards.flavor: As the dissolving world bled into itself, people's faiths shaped the very heavens. And the heavens were merciful.
cards.name: Bringer of Blessed Ends
cards.text:
Flying, vigilance
Protection from Humans (This creature can't be blocked, targeted or dealt damage by Humans.)

cards.flavor: As the night stretched on, the whispers in Vashi's mind grew louder, and he recognized the voices as those of his people. Their thoughts mingled with his own. Became his own. And his theirs.
cards.name: Brink of Something
cards.text: Target player draws seven cards, then their life total becomes equal to the number of cards in their hand.

cards.name: Cackling Seer
cards.text:
Haste
Revive {3}{R} ({3}{R}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of this card, except it has no mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: The woman danced through the canopies, shimmering and incandescent as leaves and vegetation were pulled along in her wake.
cards.name: Canopy Dancer
cards.text:
Reach
Once each turn, when Canopy Dancer deals damage, you may untap it.

cards.flavor: Resilient to magic by nature, Hadik was a bastion of sanity in a world quickly losing its sense of self. With a touch, he could banish the ever encroaching whispers.
cards.name: Clarity of Self
cards.text: Target creature you control gains protection from everything until end of turn.

cards.name: Collector of Memories
cards.text:
Whenever you draw a card, you may exile the top card of your library.
{3}{U}{U}, Sacrifice Collector of Memories: Shuffle your hand into your library, then put each card exiled with Collector of Memories into its owner's hand.

cards.name: Corrupted Soothsayer
cards.text:
Whenever an opponent casts a spell, that player gets a poison counter unless they pay {1}.
As long as an opponent has five or more poison counters, Corrupted Soothsayer gets +2/+1 and has flying.

cards.name: Crooked Growth
cards.text:
You may play an additional land this turn.
Draw a card.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Cruel Heartbeat
cards.text:
Gain control of target creature until end of turn. Untap it. Until end of turn, it gains haste and “This creature can't be blocked.”
{1}, Discard Cruel Heartbeat: Add one mana of any color. Scry 1.

cards.flavor: Her wounds sealed shut, and her skin grew rigid. She believed she would last, and the world answered.
cards.name: Crystallized Hope
cards.text:
You gain 3 life. Choose one —
• You gain 3 life.
• Draw a card.

cards.flavor: “These tiny, misguided things. They cry out against their fates with all the violence of insect wings.”
cards.name: Cursory Glance
cards.text: Counter target spell with mana value 3 or less.

cards.name: Dawn Without End
cards.text:
Dawn Without End deals damage to each opponent equal to the number of nonbasic lands they control.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Death Kneels Before
cards.text:
Return up to two target creature cards from your graveyard to your hand.
Coalesce {7}{B} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {7}{B}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)

cards.flavor:
“This world will end, but beyond it we shall tower above the very stars.”
— Vashi, Twin-Star Paragon
cards.name: Destiny Beyond Measure
cards.text:
When Destiny Beyond Measure enters, tap each creature you control.
Creatures you control get +8/+8 and have “This creature enters tapped.”

cards.flavor: In a moment of distraction, Vashi's thoughts fled from him entirely. And in the silence that followed found meaning.
cards.name: Disassociate
cards.text: When Disassociate enters, exile target creature until Disassociate leaves the battlefield.

cards.flavor: Mishka froze, torn between a dozen courses of action, and she could no longer recognize which ones were their own.
cards.name: Do No Evil
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever enchanted creature attacks or blocks, its controller gets a poison counter.

cards.flavor: In the moments after, nothing moved. Until Hadik slowly raised one blood soaked arm.
cards.name: Drenched in Triumph
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Whenever a creature dealt damage by enchanted creature this turn dies, put a +1/+1 counter on enchanted creature.
When enchanted creature dies, draw a card.

cards.name: Drown Amidst the Cosmos
cards.text:
This spell can't be countered.
Tap up to three target permanents.
Coalesce {9}{U}{U} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {9}{U}{U}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
Opponents can't untap more than two permanents during their untap steps while Drown Amidst the Cosmos is on the battlefield.

cards.name: Elusive Devout
cards.text:
Hexproof
When Elusive Devout enters, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Elusive Devout.
• Create a colorless artifact token named Lotus Petal with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”

cards.name: Elusive Hunter
cards.text:
Flash
{U}, Put Elusive Hunter into its owner's library second from the top: Counter up to one target spell unless its controller pays {2}.

cards.name: Emberheart Witch

rulings.text: The ability counts itself, so will always do at least 1 damage.

cards.text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature enters under your control, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
When this creature dies, it deals X damage to target player or planeswalker, where X is the number of cards and tokens merged with it.

cards.name: Embrace of Mist
cards.text:
Target player shuffles up to three target cards from their graveyard into their library.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: There will be no more days like this.
cards.name: End of All Things
cards.text:
Exile up to one target activated ability, triggered ability, or nonland permanent.
Coalesce {5}{G}{W}{U} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {5}{G}{W}{U}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
End of All Things enters tapped.

changes: 2022-07-01 — Now freecasts up to one of its cards and puts the others into your hand. It also mills instead of tucking.
cards.name: Endless Helpless Souls
cards.text:
Mill five cards. You may choose up to two nonland cards with mana value 2 or less milled this way. You may cast one without paying its mana cost. Put the rest into your hand.
Coalesce {6}{G}{W} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {6}{G}{W}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
Flying, vigilance

cards.name: Essence Carver
cards.text: Whenever Essence Carver blocks or becomes blocked by a creature with toughness 4 or greater, Essence Carver gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.flavor:
“I ran faster than I ever have, but I still didn't expect to find you here. Why did you wait?”
— Ata, to Bahri
cards.name: Ethereal Runner
cards.text:
Lifelink
Whenever you draw your second card each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Ethereal Runner.

cards.flavor:
“I stayed because you promised we'd see each other again.”
— Bahri, to Ata
cards.name: Ethereal Sneak
cards.text: Whenever you draw your second card each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Ethereal Sneak.

cards.name: Everember Phoenix

rulings.text: Everember Phoenix normally gets a card named Everember Phoenix, but it may get a different card if it is part of a getalt pile.

cards.text:
Flying
Whenever Everember Phoenix deals combat damage to a player or planeswalker, you may put target exiled card you own or card in your graveyard that shares a name with it into your hand.
Revive {1}{R}{R} ({1}{R}{R}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of this card, except it has no mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.)

cards.name: Fade
cards.text: Counter target spell unless its controller pays {2}. If that spell is countered this way, exile it instead of putting it into its owner's graveyard.

cards.name: Faith Burns Brightest
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a creature.
Faith Burns Brightest deals damage equal to the sacrificed creature's power to any target.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: Later, the seers would say it was little more than a visage of the whole. Nothing more than slaying a mirage. But in that moment, it was victory.
cards.name: Fall of Masha
cards.text: Whenever a creature dies, create a 1/1 red and green Warrior creature token if this is the first time this ability has resolved this turn. Otherwise, you draw a card and you lose 1 life.

cards.name: Fate Takes its Course
cards.text:
Search target opponent's library for a nonland card. You may cast that card without paying its mana cost. Then that player shuffles.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: Animals soon disappeared from the camp, yet the nights never grew quieter in their absence.
cards.name: Fauna Tender
cards.text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature enters under your control, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
This creature gets +2/+2 as long as it's merged with another card or token.

cards.flavor: “All I see is a future of turmoil. The further I look, the harder it becomes to remember who I am. And beyond it all, there lies nothing.”
cards.name: Feathered Oracle
cards.text: Whenever you draw your second card each turn, draw a card.

cards.name: Feral Devout
cards.text:
Trample
When Feral Devout enters, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Feral Devout.
• Create a colorless artifact token named Lotus Petal with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”

cards.name: Fervent Devout
cards.text:
Menace
When Fervent Devout enters, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Fervent Devout.
• Create a colorless artifact token named Lotus Petal with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”

cards.name: Fields of Worship
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Tap an untapped creature you control: Add one mana of any color. You gain 1 life.

cards.name: Firefish Conjurer
cards.text: At the beginning of each combat, you may have Firefish Conjurer deal 3 damage to target creature you control. If you do, Firefish Conjurer gets +2/+0 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.flavor: When fate calls, the body can do nothing but obey.
cards.name: Flesh Willing
cards.text:
You may put a creature card with mana value 2 or less from your hand onto the battlefield.
Draw a card.

changes: 2023-02-01 — Now triggers once whenever an opponent draws one or more cards instead of triggering on each card.
2024-09-01 — Changed from a trigger when an opponent finishes drawing cards to a replacement.
cards.name: Fleshscale Serpent
cards.text: If an opponent would draw one or more cards except for the first one they draw in each of their draw steps, instead they draw those cards, then may pay {1}. If they don't pay, they get a poison counter and you draw a card

cards.flavor: Surrender grows easier with practice.
cards.name: Fold Will
cards.text:
This spell costs {2} less to cast if its target's controller is poisoned.
Counter target spell unless its controller pays {X}.

cards.name: Fortune Dealer
cards.text:
At the beginning of each combat, target creature you control gets +3/+3 until end of turn.
Revive {2}{B}{R}{G} ({2}{B}{R}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of this card, except it has no mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: The stars had always helped guide the clans from settlement to settlement. But as the constellations began to change, Mishka no longer trusted where they might lead.
cards.name: From Stars Above
cards.text: You may reveal a Revelation card you own from outside the game or choose a face-up Revelation card you own in exile. Put that card into your hand. Exile From Stars Above.

cards.name: From Unbidden Realms
cards.text:
You gain 3 life and you mill three cards.
Coalesce {5}{G} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {5}{G}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)

cards.flavor: As the world grew more twisted, and even the sight of the horizon began to instill madness, Mishka cloaked the settlement in a comforting illusion.
cards.name: Gentle Omens
cards.text: Draw two cards, then create an X/X white Illusion creature token, where X is the number of cards you've drawn this turn.

changes: 2023-04-01 — Now discards and draws up to two cards, rather than your entire hand.
cards.name: Gentle Repose
cards.text:
Discard up to two cards, then draw that many cards.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: While the others were focused on fighting Masha, Tahli and what remained of the Twin-Stars quietly carried the dazed Mishka back to the settlement.
cards.name: Gift to Finality
cards.text: Choose target creature you control. Mill cards equal to its power, then it fights up to one target creature you don't control.

cards.name: Gilded Bloodsworn
cards.text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature enters under your control, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
This creature gets +2/+2 and has trample as long as it's merged with another card or token.

cards.name: Give Penance
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature doesn't untap during its controller's untap step.
Untap each Horror you control during enchanted creature's controller's untap step.

cards.name: Give to Sacred Halls
cards.text:
Destroy target creature or planeswalker if damage has been dealt to it this turn. Then Give to Sacred Halls deals 1 damage to it.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Gleaming Elf
cards.text: Whenever you draw your second card each turn, other creatures you control get +1/+1 and gain indestructible until end of turn.

changes: 2024-01-02 — Now impulse draws and mana washes the top seven cards of an opponent's library, rather than impulse drawing your hand and the top seven cards of your own library.
cards.name: Grasp for Understanding
cards.text:
When you cast this spell, each other player may copy it.
Exile the top seven cards of an opponent's library. Until the end of your next turn, you may play those cards, and you may spend mana as though it was mana of any type to cast those spells.

cards.name: Grisly Offering
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of each combat, you may have Grisly Offering deal 3 damage to target creature you control. If you do, Grisly Offering gets +3/+0 until end of turn.

cards.name: Hadik, Might of Mortals
cards.text:
Trample
Whenever an opponent casts a noncreature spell for the first time each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Hadik, Might of Mortals. It gains indestructible until end of turn.
Revive {3}{R}{G} ({3}{R}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of this card, except it has no mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.)

cards.flavor:
“We'll fight. If we're forced to kneel, then we'll fight from our knees. If we're struck down, then we'll fight from the grave.”
— Rekha, Silver-Dawn Warrior
cards.name: Hadik's Cohort
cards.text: Whenever one or more creature cards leave your graveyard, Hadik's Cohort deals 2 damage to target opponent.

cards.flavor: With every week, more twisted things came from the wilds. Yet the Silver-Dawn clan survived. Not due to Hadik's martial prowess, nor Mishka's tricks, but from the stubbornness of its people.
cards.name: Hadik's Striker
cards.text: Whenever Hadik's Striker is dealt damage, you gain that much life.

cards.flavor:
“How lucky I am to see this cycle. To see violence honed into such beautiful things.”
— Makshi, Patron of Blades
cards.name: Hail of Blades
Hallowed Moon Sentinel
cards.text:
Lifelink
Whenever you cast a spell with mana value 2 or less, put a +1/+1 counter on Hallowed Moon Sentinel.

cards.name: Harvest Flesh
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during your turn and only during the declare attackers step or with its acquiesce ability.
Untap all creatures you control. After this phase, there is an additional combat phase.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Heavenly Emergence
cards.text:
Create a 2/2 white Angel creature token with flying.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Heavenly Fire
cards.text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature enters under your control, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
Whenever this creature attacks, if it's merged with another card or token, it deals 2 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.name: Heavens Claim Their Due
cards.text:
Tap up to two target creatures.
Coalesce {5}{W}{W} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {5}{W}{W}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
Heavens Claim Their Due enters tapped.

cards.name: Heavens Held Waiting
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, you gain 1 life. Then each opponent may give themselves a poison counter. For each opponent who doesn't, create a 2/2 white Angel creature token with flying.

cards.name: Helar's Herald
cards.text:
Flying, lifelink
When Helar's Herald dies, target opponent may give themselves two poison counters. If they do, return Helar's Herald to its owner's hand. Otherwise, return Helar's Herald to the battlefield tapped under its owner's control.

cards.flavor: Some part of Kiha's mind recognized that what she was looking at was horrific. But that feeling was drowned beneath an unbidden sea of quiet awe.
cards.name: Helar's Sanctifier
cards.text: At the beginning of each combat, up to one target creature can't attack or block this turn.

cards.name: Helar Ritualist
cards.text:
Flying
When Helar Ritualist enters or whenever you cast a spell, if {W}{B} was spent to cast it, each opponent loses 3 life and you gain 3 life. Put a +1/+1 counter on Helar Ritualist.

cards.name: Helene, Bound by Might
cards.text:
During your turn, Helene is a 4/4 Human Warrior creature with hexproof and trample that's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to her during your turn.
[+1]: Create a green Stance enchantment token with “When a creature you control deals combat damage to an opponent, sacrifice this. If you do, draw a card.”
[-2]: Create a blue Stance enchantment token with “When an opponent casts a noncreature spell, sacrifice this. If you do, counter that spell.”

cards.name: Hollyberry Murder
cards.text:
Flying, deathtouch
Revive {3}{B} ({3}{B}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of this card, except it has no mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: Mishka understood the threat the whispers posed, and treated every new face with increasing suspicion. But even at the height of their paranoia, she never expected a fellow seer to fall.
cards.name: Hungering Cult
cards.text:
Lifelink
Whenever another creature you control enters, Hungering Cult deals 3 damage to it.

cards.name: Ichorsap Dryad
cards.text:
{T}: Add one mana of any color. You can't spend this mana to cast spells with mana value 3 or greater.
Revive {2}{G} ({2}{G}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of this card, except it has no mana cost. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.)

cards.name: Ill-Fated Seer
cards.text:
When Ill-Fated Seer enters, each player sacrifices a creature. If they can't, Ill-Fated Seer deals 3 damage to them.
Revive {2}{B}{R} ({2}{B}{R}, Exile this card from your graveyard: Create a token that's a copy of this card, except it has no mana cost. Activate only as a sorcery.)

cards.flavor: As a child, a herd of deer has passed straight through Mishka's camp, oddly unconcerned with the people within. She became fascinated with the creatures, and often turned to their image in times of stress.
cards.name: Illusory Stag
cards.text:
Flash
Trample

cards.flavor: “Our song will bring you peace, if you would only stop to listen.”
cards.name: Immaculate Choir
cards.text: At the beginning of each opponent's end step, that player gets a poison counter unless damage was dealt this turn.

cards.flavor: When the woman turned, a dozen faces turned with her. Overlaid one on top of the other, each sharing the same space.
cards.name: Incandescent Matron
cards.text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature enters under your control, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
Whenever this creature attacks, target creature blocks it this combat if able.

changes: 2023-08-01 — Trigger has been reworked. It now exiles the top card of target opponent's library and lets you cast it mana-washed. If it's a land card, that player also gets a poison counter. (Originally, took and untapped a permanent from each opponent of their choice unless they sacrificed it and got a poison counter.)
2022-02-01 — Now hits "each opponent who controls four or more permanents" rather than "target opponent."
cards.name: Infectious Ego
cards.text:
Lifelink
Whenever Infectious Ego enters or attacks, exile the top card of target opponent's library. If it's a land card, that player gets a poison counter. You may play that card for as long as it remains exiled, and you may spend mana as though it were mana of any color to cast that spell.

cards.name: Inflicted Ideals
cards.text: Once each turn, when a player casts a spell, you may choose two target players. Each of those players exiles cards from the top of their library until they exile a nonland card with mana value less than that spell's. They may cast those cards without paying their mana cost. Then they put the rest of the exiled cards on the bottom of their library in a random order. (The active player puts their spell on the stack first.)

cards.name: Inscrutable Realms
cards.text:
Inscrutable Realms enters tapped unless you control two or more other lands.
{T}: Add {W}.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {G} or {U}.

cards.name: Inviolable Realms
cards.text:
Inviolable Realms enters tapped unless you control two or more other lands.
{T}: Add {U}.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {W} or {B}.

cards.name: Ironhide Bellower
cards.text:
Trample
At the beginning of each combat, you may have Ironhide Bellower deal 3 damage to target creature you control. If you do, Ironhide Bellower gets +3/+0 and can't be blocked by creatures with total power 3 or less until end of turn.

cards.name: Kalemn, Bound by Violence
cards.text:
As long as there are seven or more loyalty counters on Kalemn, she has lifelink and deathtouch.
[+2]: Kalemn deals 2 damage to each opponent.
[+1]: Kalemn deals 1 damage to target creature or planeswalker.
[-7]: For each opponent, Kalemn deals 3 damage to that player unless they discard a card. Repeat this process six times.

cards.name: Keep What Was Lost
cards.text:
Return target creature, instant, or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand. Then exile Keep What Was Lost if it wasn't cast from your hand.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: All things shall come to an end, and all things shall be made anew.
cards.name: Legion Angel
cards.text:
Flying
When Legion Angel enters, you may reveal a card you own named Legion Angel from outside the game and put it into your hand.

cards.name: Litany of Fallen Blades
cards.text:
Target player discards a card. If they can't, you draw a card and they lose 2 life.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: So little remained of the departed soul that was left was a void rather than a memory. Something hollow and twisted, eager to claim the first spark of life it came across.
cards.name: Lonely Visage
cards.text: Flying, deathtouch

cards.flavor: The petals of the lotus grant visions and strength of mind to clan seers. But the roots and stems are reserved for more mundane blessings.
cards.name: Lotusleaf Blade
cards.text:
Trample
Lotusleaf Blade gets +1/+1 as long as you control another Warrior.

cards.name: Lustrous Devout
cards.text:
Flying
When Lustrous Devout enters, choose one —
• Put a +1/+1 counter on Lustrous Devout.
• Create a colorless artifact token named Lotus Petal with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”

cards.flavor: “Take pride, mortal. You've forged such lovely tools of destruction before your end.”
cards.name: Makshi, Patron of Blades
cards.text: When Makshi, Patron of Blades enters, search your library for an Equipment card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}. Spend this mana only to cast Equipment spells and activate abilities of Equipment.

cards.flavor: The four fighters danced around the towering god. Hadik and Rekha's spears struck from a distance while Kalemn and Helene matched Masha's crushing strength with their own.
cards.name: Martial Mastery
cards.text: Target creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn. Then draw a card if that creature is a Warrior.

cards.name: Masha Ritualist
cards.text:
First strike
When Masha Ritualist enters or whenever you cast a spell, if {B}{G} was spent to cast it, return target creature card with mana value 3 or less from a graveyard to the battlefield under your control. Put a +1/+1 counter on Masha Ritualist.

cards.name: Mirror Reality
cards.text:
The next time you cast an instant or sorcery spell this turn, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Misery Keeps Company
cards.text:
Create a 1/1 blue Illusion creature token with “This gets +1/+1 for each other Illusion you control.”
Coalesce {6}{B} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {6}{B}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
Misery Keeps Company is an Illusion in addition to its other types while it's a creature.

cards.name: Mishka's Conjuring
cards.text:
Create a 1/1 blue Illusion creature token with “This gets +1/+1 for each other Illusion you control.”
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: Concepts forced themselves upon the world, folding reality around them until they became impenetrable.

cards.text:
Defender
When Mnemonic Wall enters, you may return target instant or sorcery card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature enters under your control, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
Double strike
If this creature would deal noncombat damage, it deals double that damage instead.

cards.flavor:
The scout spoke from her mount. “I spotted a pair of women just north of here. Their clothes are... foreign, but they seem normal enough.”
“If they were normal,” Hadik replied, “they wouldn't be alive.”
cards.name: Monokeros Rider
cards.text: Flying

cards.flavor: That which was built will collapse. That which had bloomed will wilt. That which had created will consume.
cards.name: Mortal Deeds
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Destroy target artifact or enchantment.
• Search your library for up to two basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle.

cards.text:
Choose a creature card name. Each player sacrifices a creature, then each player who controls a creature with the chosen name gets a poison counter.
Draw a card.

cards.flavor: “Little walker of worlds. You will hunt what we have lost, and make us whole.”

cards.text:
Target opponent takes an extra turn after this one. Until your next turn, you control that player during extra turns.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: For some, the whispers were calm. Loving. For others, they were a reminder of all the harm they had caused, and would continue to cause.
cards.name: Overwhelming Guilt
cards.text: Target opponent reveals their hand. You may choose a noncreature, nonland card from it. If you do, that player discards that card. Otherwise, they lose 3 life.

cards.flavor: Filled with peace, her body grew faint so that her soul could shine all the brighter.
cards.name: Palesoul Mender
cards.text: When Palesoul Mender dies, you gain life equal to its toughness.

cards.flavor: For centuries, the visions of the seers have let them advise their paragons with wisdom and foreknowledge. Now, those visions bring only madness.
cards.name: Perception Pool
cards.text: At the beginning of each main phase, each player adds {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}.

cards.name: Piece by Piece
cards.text:
Each opponent loses 1 life. Whenever you cast another spell this turn, each opponent loses 1 life.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.flavor: From the creators came the world, and to the creators it shall return.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
When enchanted creature dies, you draw X cards, where X is its toughness. Then you may put a land card from your hand onto the battlefield.

Deathtouch

cards.flavor: Her kin tried to hold her back, but in the Twin-Stars she saw the truth of things. Every life nothing more than a facet of the same singular being.

cards.text: Put target nonland permanent on the bottom of its owner's library. You gain life equal to the number of poison counters its owner has.

cards.text:

cards.flavor:
“Our paragon disappeared into the ocean weeks ago. I lead us now, and I'm not sure we can survive on our own.”
— Ravik, to Hadik

cards.text: Tap X untapped Shamans you control: Ravik, Still-Smoke Seer deals X damage to any target and you gain X life.

cards.name: Reconstruct

cards.flavor: When all are one, how can one be anything other than utterly, desperately alone?

cards.flavor: “Open your mind to us.”
cards.name: Seeker of Communions

cards.flavor: As much as Mishka and Hadik tried to keep the whispers at bay and the clan together, every few days saw another soul leave the settlement in search of something more.
cards.name: Seeker of New Truths
cards.text:
Lifelink
Revelation spells you cast cost {1} less to cast.

cards.flavor: Mishka's heart was bitter as her illusions moved through the trees. Clan seers were meant to provide foresight and wisdom, but all she had were tricks and deceit.

cards.text: Serene Hart can't be blocked by creatures with power 4 or greater.

cards.name: Setar Ritualist

Menace

cards.flavor: Though the settlements are permanent, their inhabitants are nomadic. Clans move from one to the other according to the patterns of the stars. But in their absence, they are not left undefended.

cards.text: {2}: Settlement Guardian gets +1/+1 until end of turn for each color of mana spent to activate this ability.

cards.flavor: “It's safe, but... for some reason, the Twin-Stars haven't left yet.”

Trample

Enchant creature
All creatures with power less than enchanted creature's toughness able to block enchanted creature do so.

cards.flavor: Unity of purpose. Unity of belief. Unity of thought. They do not seek to destroy. They seek to grow.

cards.text:

Coalesce {7} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {7}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)

cards.name: Upon Fourfold Wings
cards.text:
Create a 2/2 white Angel creature token with flying.
Coalesce {6}{W}{W} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {6}{W}{W}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)
Flying

cards.name: Vashi, Twin-Star Paragon
cards.text:
Gestalt (When this or another creature enters under your control, you may merge it with the one in play, keeping counters and attachments. They become the permanent on top plus all abilities from under it.)
If this creature would die, you may instead put a card or token merged with it into its owner's graveyard. If you do, remove all damage marked on this creature.

changes: 2023-07-01 — Renamed from Wanderer of Endless Paths
cards.name: Visage of Emeria
cards.text:
Once each turn, you may activate an additional loyalty ability of a planeswalker you control.
[+1]: You gain 1 life for each loyalty ability you've activated this turn. Scry 1.
[0]: Put a +1/+1 counter on target creature. It can't attack or block until your next turn.
[-3]: Exile target creature with power 4 or greater.

cards.name: Void Hilt
Walker of the Final Path
cards.text:
Walker of the Final Path gets +3/+3 and has trample as long as you control a Horror.
When Walker of the Final Path enters, search your library for a Revelation card, put it into your graveyard, then shuffle.

cards.name: Walking Remorse
cards.text:
Lifelink
Whenever Walking Remorse or another creature dies, Walking Remorse deals 1 damage to target player or planeswalker.

cards.name: Watch from Above
cards.text:
Target player mills two cards.
Draw a card.
Coalesce {6}{U} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {6}{U}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)

cards.name: Weave Etcher
cards.text:
Whenever Weave Etcher enters or equipped creature attacks, create a colorless artifact token named Lotus Petal with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”
Equip {1}

changes: 2023-03-01 — Is now an upkeep trigger rather than an end step trigger.
cards.name: Weeping Lotus
cards.text:
Weeping Lotus enters with five petal counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, remove a petal counter from Weeping Lotus. If you do, create a colorless artifact token named Lotus Petal with “{T}, Sacrifice this artifact: Add one mana of any color.”

cards.flavor: With every encroaching thought, the individual grows lesser.
cards.name: Weeping Whisperer
cards.text:
Deathtouch
Each opponent's maximum hand size is reduced by the number of poison counters that player has.

cards.name: Welcome What Comes
cards.text:
Put two +1/+1 counters on up to one target creature.
Coalesce {6}{G}{G} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {6}{G}{G}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)

cards.flavor: “Does the struggle not wear down on you? Life is made so that it may one day end.”
cards.name: What Little Remains
cards.text:
Enchant permanent
Whenever enchanted permanent becomes untapped, its controller gets a poison counter.

cards.flavor:
“You may feel broken. You may feel beaten. But if you can feel, then there is still fight left in you.”
— Hadik, Silver-Dawn Paragon
cards.name: While Blood Still Flows
cards.text: Add {W}{U}{B}{R}{G}. Spend this mana only to cast spells from your graveyard or activate abilities of cards in your graveyard.

cards.name: Whims of Fate
cards.text:
Discard your hand, shuffle your library, then draw three cards. You may cast a nonland card from your hand without paying its mana cost.
Acquiesce (If you cast this spell from your hand, exile it as it resolves. When one or more creatures you control deal combat damage to an opponent, you may cast this card from exile without paying its mana cost.)

cards.name: Wild Realms
cards.text:
Wild Realms enters tapped unless you control two or more other lands.
{T}: Add {G}.
{T}, Pay 1 life: Add {R} or {W}.

cards.name: Witness the Divine
cards.text:
Destroy all non-Horror creatures.
Coalesce {8}{W}{W} (You may cast this from your graveyard for {8}{W}{W}. If you do, it enters as a Horror creature after it resolves. Exile it if it would leave the battlefield or not resolve.)

cards.name: World Made Anew
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast this spell, sacrifice a land.
You may put a land card you own from outside the game onto the battlefield.

cards.flavor: The distortion floated harmlessly above the surface of the water for days. At first the size of a fist, it only grew with time. Until, at last, it shattered.
cards.name: World Torn Asunder
cards.text: Destroy target creature or planeswalker, then exile its controller's graveyard.
